items.item_details:
The Board of Trustees offers an opportunity for the public to address the Board in four sections of the agenda: on matters of concern about Closed Session items; on matters not appearing on the agenda; on action items contained in the Consent Agenda; and prior to voting on any item contained in the Action Agenda. Each speaker is encouraged to submit a comment card to the Board clerk in order to be recognized to speak.
	Per Board Policy, three minutes may be allotted to each speaker with a maximum of 30 minutes per subject. No action or discussion shall be undertaken on any public comments except that members of the Board or its staff may briefly respond to or ask a question for clarification regarding statements made or questions posed by persons addressing the Board under this agenda item.
	For information and disability access to materials, call 408-270-6402. Meetings are held in a location accessible to the disabled.

items.item_details:
The District employs non-bargaining unit employees in various categories to support programs and services.  These categories are: short-term assignments with limitations as defined in the CSEA/District collective bargaining agreement; substitutes to fill positions for employees on leave of absence or in vacant positions; professional experts with specialized knowledge or expertise not generally required of, or found within, the employee classifications established by the Governing Board; and athletic support staff for athletic activities.
	 
Student Tutor Position Establishment

Translation and Interpretation (T & I) Tutor

items.item_details:
Education Code 81655 stipulates that no contract is an enforceable obligation of the District until it has been approved by the Board of Trustees. Board Policy 6100 establishes the authority of certain administrators to approve contracts under the bid limit prior to formal Board approval. All contracts and purchase orders exceeding the current bid limit of $84,100 shall have prior Board approval as a separate board item.
This consent item presents for Board approval: all purchase orders for this period, which includes purchase orders for administratively approved contracts exceeding $1,000, as well as additional contracts that, although are not executed by way of purchase order, are deemed appropriate to be added by the Purchasing Department.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees ratify the contracts and purchase orders for the period of April 10, 2014 through May 9, 2014 as noted in the attached documents.

SG 098:      Directed Study

items.item_details:
Evergreen Valley College's Automotive Technology program received grant funds in the amount of $175,000 from the Workforce and Economic Development Division, State Energy Resources Conservation and Development Commission.
	 
Evergreen Valley College has an established alternative vehicle program but is limited to an introductory course on alternative vehicles (Auto 181A) and basic hybrid maintenance and repair (Auto 181B). With these grant funds the existing courses will be updated to include plug-in hybrid and all electric vehicles. These two courses will cover the key topics in hybrid, plug-in hybrid, and all electric vehicles including powertrains, controls, battery management, motor and power electronics. Attendees will receive an overview of the critical technologies and components used in modern hybrid, plug-in and electric vehicles and will gain hands-on experience conducting routine maintenance procedures, common repairs and diagnostic procedures through demonstrations, active participation and data measurement.  
	 
An additional course will be developed to include CNG tank inspection certification.
items.item_recommendation: It is recommended the Board of Trustees accept grant funds in the amount of $175,000 from the California Community Colleges Chancellor's Office.
items.item_text: Acceptance of Grant Funds - Evergreen Valley College
items.item_text_raw: 9. Acceptance of Grant Funds - Evergreen Valley College

items.item_details:
On March 25, 2014, April 1, 2014, April 8, 2014, and April 15, 2014, the attached Request for Qualifications & Proposal G2010.0089 – Contractor Outreach Consulting Services and subsequent amendments was advertised to assist the District in implementing the Local Business Outreach Program for Minority-Owned, Women-Owned, and Small Business outreach plan that was approved by the Board on September 13, 2011 (Item I-4). With the direction from the Board and Chancellor, this solicitation was developed by the Vice Chancellor of Administrative Services; the Director of Facilities and Bond Program Management; the Assistant Director of Fiscal Services; the Director of Community Relations, EEO and Diversity; a Purchasing Agent, and representatives of Gilbane. The focus of the solicitation is to increase the participation of diverse small businesses, which includes minority- owned, women-owned, disabled veteran-owned and small businesses, to achieve the District’s 15% outreach goal with particular emphasis on the current Measure G-2010 construction activity. 
	 
The District received five proposals.  After consideration and review, the evaluation committee invited all five to be interviewed. Along with District staff and Gilbane, the evaluation committee included four community members representative of the District’s diverse population and active in the support of social and economic justice issues. By consensus, the evaluation committee recommended two vendors, L. Luster & Associates, Inc. and Enterprise Foundation, for consideration and a possible collaboration to achieve the District’s 15% outreach goal.  
	 
Although the contract is awaiting successful negotiations of terms, the recommendation is that the Board approve this agenda item to allow the District to enter into a contract with the selected vendor(s) immediately after the contract is finalized. This urgency is in the best interest to the District because time sensitive Measure G-2010 projects are being developed and the District would like to insert this dynamic into the process. A subsequent request for Board ratification will be brought to the Board meeting scheduled for Tuesday, July 8, 2014 to formally announce the selected vendors and dollar amount of the proposal.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees authorize the Chancellor to award a contract for the Request for Qualifications & Proposal G2010.0089 – Contractor Outreach Consulting Services. A subsequent ratification shall be forthcoming to further specify the dollar amount of and parties to the contract.
items.item_text: Award of Contract for Request for Qualifications & Proposal G200089 – Contractor Outreach Consulting Services for SJECCD
items.item_text_raw: 10. Award of Contract for Request for Qualifications & Proposal G2010.0089 – Contractor Outreach Consulting Services for SJECCD

items.item_details:
The MOU between AACI and EVC is to establish the term and conditions to work collaboratively to provide the Patient Community Navigator program.
	 
The Certificate of Specialization: Patient Community Navigator is offered by EVC and is an 11-unit certificate designed to train individuals to better understand the complexities of the health care system, and communicate effectively in a variety of situations so they can help patients and their families obtain health care services.  Patient Navigators help patients overcome the barriers that keep them from getting timely care.  The college-level courses prepare individuals for employment in a health care institution or agency.  The Board of Trustees approved the certificate program on January 14, 2014.
	 
Term:  The MOU is effective June 1, 2014 through June 30, 2015.
	 
Funding:  EVC will invoice AACI up to an amount of $48,079.  This shall include the cost of faculty and support staff, student enrollment fees and other student costs such as supplies, parking and book rental.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve the MOU between Asian Americans for Community Involvement (AACI) and the San José-Evergreen Community College District—Evergreen Valley College—to partner and provide the Patient Navigator Training Program.
items.item_text: MOU between Asian Americans for Community Involvement and Evergreen Valley College
items.item_text_raw: 11. MOU between Asian Americans for Community Involvement and Evergreen Valley College

items.item_details:
The District is required to submit, on an annual basis, a Five Year Capital Construction Plan to the State Chancellor's Office that summarizes current and proposed capital outlay projects.  This plan includes all state and locally funded capital construction projects the District will be working on within the next five years.  This plan is required to be adopted by the Board of Trustees.
 
The Plan is being presented to the Board of Trustees as a final document for approval. Minor edits may be made to the Plan at the request of the State Chancellorâs Office once submitted to the State.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve the Five Year Capital Construction Plan as required by the State Chancellor's Office as a provision under Community College Construction Act (California Education Code Section 81800).

items.item_details:
On October 8, 2013 the Board agreed to enter into a contract with XL Construction, to provide design-build services for the renovation of the new District Office located at 40 S. Market Street. Construction contracts often times experience unforeseen conditions, coordination gaps and/or design changes, particularly renovations and Design-Build contracts that require an adjustment to the contract price and/or duration in the form of a Change Order.  During the Design phase and early demolition, several items were re-evaluated for long and near term value to the District.  This process precipitated design changes and subsequent change requests from XL Construction.  These change requests were reviewed for scope, value and conformance with the contract documents.
	 
	 
Original Contract Amount               $6,100,000
Previous Approved Changes          $   
Change Order No. 001                   $    648,184
	 
Total Contract and Changes           $ 6,748,184
	 
The net change to XL Constructionsâ contract as a result of this change issued will be $648,184, which equates to 10.6% of the base contract.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve Change Order No. 001 in the amount of $648,184 for the SJECCD New District Office.
items.item_text: Measure G-2010 Bond Program: San Jose Evergreen Community College District - New District Office Renovation #G2010.0060, Project #39301 XL Construction Change Order No. 001
items.item_text_raw: 5. Measure G-2010 Bond Program: San Jose Evergreen Community College District - New District Office Renovation #G2010.0060, Project #39301 XL Construction Change Order No. 001

items.item_details:
On May 14, 2013 the Board agreed to enter into a contract with Swenson & Associates to provide construction services to renovate and upgrade the Central Plant and Police Station at Evergreen Valley College. 
	 
Construction contracts often times experience unforeseen conditions, coordination gaps and/or design changes that require an adjustment to the contract price and/or duration in the form of a Change Order.  Change Order #010 includes modifications to existing floor and concrete walls, an addition of an electrical connection, tile reducers, break metal, an extension of casework and a revision to wall framing. Swenson & Associates submitted written pricing proposals for changes detailed in the Agenda attachment that include additional or deleted materials, equipment, labor, time extensions as applicable and the prescribed mark-ups.  The proposals have been reviewed to ensure the pricing reflects compliance with contract terms.
	 
The seven items in this change order result in an ADD to the contract of $13,562.
	 
Original Contract Amount                $9,965,000
Previous Approved Changes             $338,578
Change Order #010                             $13,562
Total Contract and Changes         $10,317,140
	 
The total net change to Swensonâs contract as a result of all Change Orders is $352,140, which equates to 3.53% of the base contract.
	 
The Substantial Completion Date remains unchanged at June 12, 2014.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve Change Order No. 010 for Swenson & Associates in the amount of $13,562 of the Central Plant and Police Station Renovation Project at Evergreen Valley College.
items.item_text: Measure G-2010 Bond Program: Evergreen Valley College Central Plant and Police Station Renovation Project - Swenson & Associates Change Order No. 010
items.item_text_raw: 6. Measure G-2010 Bond Program: Evergreen Valley College Central Plant and Police Station Renovation Project - Swenson & Associates Change Order No. 010

items.item_details:
On April 10, 2013 the board approved a Contract in the amount of $568,000 which consisted of mechanical, electrical and plumbing upgrades of equipment, preventative maintenance of switches, switchboards and transformers at various San Jose City College Buildings. 
	 
Upgrades included:
-  Replaced compressor at General Education Building
-  Replaced booster pump and pressure tank for booster pump at High Technology Center
-  Replaced air handlers and actuators at Cosmetology/Reprographics Buildings and Applied Sciences
-  Upgraded lighting in Presidential Suite at General Education Building
-  Replace exhaust fans at Library, General Education Building and Student Center
	 
Change Order No. 001 includes costs associated with the above items and deduction of remaining allowance funds from the contract.  This change was negotiated for a deductive cost of ($31,352) for a revised contract value of $536,648.  The net change to S&H Constructionâs contract as a result of all changes issued will be ($31,352), which equates to approximately negative  (5.5%) of the base contract.
	 
Original Contract Amount      $568,000
Previous Change Order(s)     $0
Change Order No. 001           $ (31,352)  
Revised Contract Amount      $536,648
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve Final Change Order No. 001 in the deductive amount of ($31,352) to S&H Construction for the Mechanical, Electrical, Plumbing Pkg. #1 project at San Jose City College.
items.item_text: Measure G-2010 Bond Program: San Jose City College Mechanical, Electrical, Plumbing Upgrades Project - S&H Construction Final Deductive Change Order No. 001
items.item_text_raw: 8. Measure G-2010 Bond Program: San Jose City College Mechanical, Electrical, Plumbing Upgrades Project - S&H Construction Final Deductive Change Order No. 001

items.item_details:
In April 2012, Evergreen Valley College (EVC) and the San Jose Evergreen Community College District (SJECCD) approached the Program Manager about upgrading various mechanical, electrical and plumbing (MEP) systems on the Evergreen Valley College Campus.  This work encompasses approximately 60 small upgrades and repairs into a consolidated project.  In February of 2013, a contract for design services was executed with the engineering firm GHD.  The EVC MEP Phase-1 project was completed between 8/14/2013 and 12/20/2013.      
	 
On May 16, 2014, bids were received for Phase-2 of the project. The bid package was posted on the District’s purchasing website, advertised in local papers and published at 20 local builders’ exchanges and plan rooms.  In addition, invitations to bid were sent to over 100 contractors including small and disadvantaged businesses.  The Engineer’s estimate for the project was $520,000.  No additive alternates were included with this project. 
	 
The bid results are as follows:
	 
JKL Construction Services, Inc.        $306,224   
Kinetics Mechanical Service              $488,573 
American Air                                      $509,482
	 
	 
Based on the evaluation of the bids received, JKL Construction Services, Inc., from San Mateo, CA is determined to be the lowest responsible bidder in the amount of $306,224.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve issuance of a construction contract to JKL Construction Services, Inc. for an amount not-to-exceed amount of $306,224 for the Evergreen Valley College (EVC) Mechanical Electrical and Plumbing Upgrade Package 2, Project #32307-06.
items.item_text: Measure G-2010 Bond Program: Evergreen Valley College Bid #G2010.0048 Mechanical Electrical and Plumbing Upgrade Package 2 Project #32307-06 – JKL Construction Services, Inc. Contract Agreement
items.item_text_raw: 9. Measure G-2010 Bond Program: Evergreen Valley College Bid #G2010.0048 Mechanical Electrical and Plumbing Upgrade Package 2 Project #32307-06 – JKL Construction Services, Inc. Contract Agreement

items.item_details:
It is required by the Division of the State Architect (DSA) to have DSA-approved inspector to ensure compliance with DSA requirements on the project.  The District issued an RFQ for Inspector of Record Services (IOR) for the Evergreen Valley College Automotive Technology Project through the Measure G-2010 pool of IOR firms.  
	 
On April 8, 2014 the District received three proposals in response to the RFQ.  The proposals were evaluated by a committee including representatives of District Purchasing, the General Contractor and Evergreen Valley College.  Proposals were scored with points in categories including: form of RFP response, availability of personnel, position rates & proposed fees, experience of lead IOR, and references of lead IOR.  
	 
On April 24, 2014 the three selected contractors were interviewed by the selection committee.  Gilbane facilitated the interviews.  The interview committee assigned points to each interviewee which was combined with the points from the proposal evaluation scoring.  Hayer Consultants, Inc. had the highest combined score and thus is recommended as IOR for the Automotive Technology project.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve issuance of an Independent Contractor Agreement to Hayer Consultants, Inc. in the amount of $171,200 for the Inspector of Record services of the Automotive Technology Project at Evergreen Valley College.
items.item_text: Measure G-2010 Bond Program: Evergreen Valley College Automotive Technology Project - Hayer Consultants, Inc. Independent Contractor Agreement
items.item_text_raw: 10. Measure G-2010 Bond Program: Evergreen Valley College Automotive Technology Project - Hayer Consultants, Inc. Independent Contractor Agreement

items.item_details:
On December 12, 2012 the Board approved a Project Assignment Amendment (PAA) to Dougherty + Dougherty for design services of the Administration Student Services Remodel project at Evergreen Valley College.  The effort to complete the assessment and programming phase of the project was more complex than expected by the college and the departments involved.  After evaluating the additional effort and time involved to complete this phase, the College, Gilbane and Dougherty + Dougherty believe the project would be best served to modify the Schematic Design Phase scope to fit the remaining funding within the contract.  As such, the SDâs will be carried to 50% completion while meetings, renderings, drawings, phasing plans and an estimate are still required.
	 
These services shall be completed as a no cost adjustment to the original agreement during an extended term through October 31, 2014.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve Revision No. 001 to Project Assignment Amendment No. EVC-01, Dougherty + Dougherty Architects, LLP as a no-cost adjustment with modifications to their scope and time of design services through October 31, 2014 for the Administration Student Services Remodel Project at Evergreen Valley College.
items.item_text: Measure G-2010 Bond Program: Evergreen Valley College (EVC) Admin Student Services Remodel Project - Dougherty + Dougherty Project Assignment Amendment EVC-01 Revision No. 001
items.item_text_raw: 11. Measure G-2010 Bond Program: Evergreen Valley College (EVC) Admin Student Services Remodel Project - Dougherty + Dougherty Project Assignment Amendment EVC-01 Revision No. 001

items.item_details:
The Division of the State Architect (DSA) requires materials testing and inspection services during the construction of the South Campus Development project.  Since this is a large and complex project, the District chose to issue a public RFQ for Testing & Inspection (T&I) Services.  The RFQ was advertised in the Daily Journal on February 21, 2014 and February 28, 2014, and posted on the District’s Purchasing Bids website.  
	 
On March 18th, 2014 the District received seven proposals in response to the RFQ for T&I services on the Project.  The proposals were evaluated by District Purchasing with assistance from Gilbane.  Proposals were scored with points assigned in categories including:  form of RFQ response, availability of personnel, position rates & proposed fees, experience of lead inspector and applicable project experience.  Based on this review, Signet Testing Laboratories, Inc. was selected as the most qualified firm.  A final scope of services was established at a contract value of $140,000, which is now presented to the Board for approval.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve issuance of an Independent Contractor Agreement to Signet Testing Laboratories, Inc. in the amount of $140,000 for the Testing and Inspection Services of the South Campus Development Project at Evergreen Valley College.
items.item_text: Measure G-2010 Bond Program: Evergreen Valley College South Campus Development Project – Signet Testing Laboratories, Inc. Independent Contractor Agreement
items.item_text_raw: 12. Measure G-2010 Bond Program: Evergreen Valley College South Campus Development Project – Signet Testing Laboratories, Inc. Independent Contractor Agreement

items.item_details:
On October 8, 2013 the Board agreed to enter into a contract with a Design Build Entity, XL Construction, to provide design and construction services for the New District Office Building project located at 40 S. Market Street.
	 
The New District Office Building Project budget includes an allowance for City of San Jose Permit Fees and it was originally anticipated that the District would pay the fees directly to the City of San Jose.  The actual cost of the permit was pending until the day the design drawings were approved by the City.  In order to expedite the project construction schedule the District authorized XL Construction to pay the fees directly to the City and agreed to reimburse XL Construction for the permit through this ICA.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve an Independent Contractor Agreement with XL Construction in the amount of $303,874.64 as reimbursement for City of San Jose Permit Fees for the New District Office Building.
items.item_text: Measure G-2010 Bond Program: Measure G-2010 Bond Program: San Jose Evergreen Community College District - New District Office Renovation #G2010.0060, Project #39301 XL Construction City Permit Fees for the New District Office Building, Independent Contractor Agreement
items.item_text_raw: 13. Measure G-2010 Bond Program: Measure G-2010 Bond Program: San Jose Evergreen Community College District - New District Office Renovation #G2010.0060, Project #39301 XL Construction City Permit Fees for the New District Office Building, Independent Contractor Agreement

items.item_details:
On February 27, 2014 Gilbane and the District issued RFP G2010.0083 for Testing and Inspection Services for the Evergreen Valley College Automotive Technology project.  
	 
On April 17, 2014 the District received three proposals in response to the RFP for Testing and Inspection services for the Automotive Technology Project. The proposals were evaluated by a committee including representatives of District Purchasing and Evergreen Valley College.  Proposals were ranked in categories including: form of RFP response, service area, minimum hourly charge and proposed testing and inspection fees. Consolidated Engineering Laboratories had the lowest hourly rate and proposed fee and thus is recommended for Testing and Inspection services for the Automotive Technology project.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve issuance of an Independent Contractor Agreement to Consolidated Engineering Laboratories in the amount of $82,948.00 for Testing and Inspection services for the Automotive Technology Project at Evergreen Valley College.
items.item_text: Measure G-2010 Bond Program: Evergreen Valley College Automotive Technology Project – Consolidated Engineering Laboratories Independent Contractor Agreement (ICA)
items.item_text_raw: 14. Measure G-2010 Bond Program: Evergreen Valley College Automotive Technology Project – Consolidated Engineering Laboratories Independent Contractor Agreement (ICA)

items.item_details:
As presented at the October 22, 2013 Board meeting, the District and Colleges are pursuing a number of Measure G-2004 funded projects that are in need of project management assistance:
	 
Joint Use 21st Century Education Center in Milpitas – The District needs project leadership to facilitate the programming, design, and construction of the future building.
	 
Physical Education Building (SJCC) - The College has not been able to commit the level of resources required to manage this project.  The PE complex project has a direct impact on the Measure G-2010 bond and without support the delay of this project has a negative impact to the G-2010 program and risks escalation costs associated with the delay.
	 
Modernization of Existing Facilities (EVC) - EVC expects to hire design firms, consultants and construction services for various projects including security infrastructure, new structures for grounds equipment and warehouse, and new bleachers at the soccer athletic field. 
	 
East Plaza Reconfiguration (EVC) – As part of the overall campus site improvements, and consistent with the 2025 Facilities Master Plan, the College has identified reconfiguration of the plaza and bus drop-off at the east section of the College as a priority.
	 
Central Green Development (EVC) – The center of campus formerly housed a cluster of portable buildings as temporary classrooms.  These were removed in 2012.  As part of the overall campus site improvements, and consistent with the 2025 Facilities Master Plan, the College has identified development of the central core of the College as a priority.
	 
Division of State Architect (DSA) – Closeout efforts continue with DSA on past projects that remain uncertified after their completion.  In many cases the applications have been closed as uncertified and must be reopened, additional fees paid, prior design firms contacted, old files researched and new applications with supporting documentation submitted.  Some of these uncertified projects are interfering with approval of applications for new projects and have the potential to create delays until the uncertified projects are satisfactorily closed out.
	 
The budget for Measure G-2004 project management services is accounted for in each of the remaining project budgets in the Measure G-2004 bond program.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve Amendment #06 to Gilbane’s PM/CM agreement to provide Project Management services for fiscal year 2014/2015 on the remaining Measure G-2004 bond projects for a not-to-exceed amount of $980,785.
items.item_text: Measure G-2004 Bond Program: Project Management Services
items.item_text_raw: 15. Measure G-2004 Bond Program: Project Management Services

items.item_details:
The District successfully passed Measure G-2010 on November 2, 2010.  On January 25, 2011 a facilities and bonds study session served as an opportunity to share a framework for success for Measure G-2010.  Included in this framework was the recommendation that the District utilize a program and construction management firm to provide program and construction management services to the colleges and District to support implementation of various construction and deferred maintenance projects.  In keeping with the District’s desire to promote accountability, efficiency and cost effectiveness, the District went through a formal Request for Qualifications process to seek the services of a Program and Construction Management firm to provide system-wide coordination and oversight of all capital improvement work performed under the Measure G-2010 bond program.  Gilbane Building Company was selected through this process. 
	 
Since the initial one-year contract with Gilbane awarded by the Board on May 10, 2011, policies and procedures for operating under the Bond have been implemented, overall program and detailed project scheduling has been established and maintained, accounting and purchasing procedures have been put in place and numerous projects have commenced design and are going into construction at the campuses and the District. 
	 
On June 12, 2012 the Board approved the second year (FY2012/2013) contract renewal with Gilbane in the amount of $4,646,050.  On June 11, 2013 the Board approved the third year (FY2013/2014) contract renewal with Gilbane in the amount of $5,627,569.
	 
Overall the Program Management budget for the life of the bond program has been established at 3% of the program budget.  Approval of the fourth year agreement stays within this 3% allocation.  Overall the Construction Management budget for the life of the bond program has been established at 9% of the construction budget.  Approval of the fourth year agreement stays within this 9% allocation.  Note that as was the case for years one and two of the agreement, Gilbane’s services for year three will come in under the original budget by approximately $450,000.
	 
Note too that the basic services and contract terms and conditions remain unchanged.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve the fourth year renewal of Gilbane’s PM/CM contract for fiscal year 2014/2015 for the not-to-exceed amount of $5,724,420.
items.item_text: Measure G-2010 PM/CM Contract Renewal for Fiscal 2014/2015
items.item_text_raw: 16. Measure G-2010 PM/CM Contract Renewal for Fiscal 2014/2015

items.item_details: The Board of Trustees adopted the District's operating budget at its meeting on September 10, 2013.  As required by Board Policy 6250, subsequent budget transfers and revisions must be approved by the Board of Trustees.

items.item_details:
Government Code Section 7908(c) requires each community college district to report its appropriation limit to the State Chancellor of Community Colleges at least annually.
	 
The appropriation limit must be approved by the Board of Trustees in accordance with Government Code Section 7910.
	 
After the Board of Trustees approves the appropriation limit, the GANN will be reported on the Annual Financial and Budget Report (CCFS-311) to the State Chancellor of Community Colleges, which is due in October 2014.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve the resolution establishing the Fiscal Year 2014-2015 Appropriation Limit (GANN).
items.item_text: Resolution Number 061014-02 Establishing the Fiscal Year 2014-2015 Appropriation Limit (GANN)
items.item_text_raw: 2. Resolution Number 061014-02 Establishing the Fiscal Year 2014-2015 Appropriation Limit (GANN)

items.item_details:
Resolution No. 061014-3 approves revised Bylaws for the District’s Citizens’ Bond Oversight Committee.  The primary goal of amending the bylaws is to incorporate recent changes to the Education Code provisions governing bond oversight committees.  The most important changes include: 
	 
Committee members are now permitted to serve three consecutive two year terms. 
District is required to provide copies of the Proposition 39 financial and performance audits to the Committee at the same time they are submitted to the Board.
District is required to provide copies of any audit responses to findings to the Committee within three months of the date the District receives the audits.
Committee members are reminded that they are subject to several of the conflict of interest provisions of the Education Code.  
	 
In addition to the above, grammar and language edits have been made for clarification purposes.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve Resolution No. 061014-3 amending and restating the Bylaws of the Independent Citizens’ Bond Oversight Committee.
items.item_text: Resolution Number 061014-3 Approving the Independent Citizens’ Bond Oversight Committee Amended and Restated Bylaws
items.item_text_raw: 3. Resolution Number 061014-3 Approving the Independent Citizens’ Bond Oversight Committee Amended and Restated Bylaws

items.item_details:
The purpose of the Tentative Budget is to obtain the Board's approval of an interim budget for the new fiscal year that will authorize the District to expend funds beginning July 1, 2014 while the Legislature deliberates and adopts a final state budget for the fiscal year. In September the Adopted Budget will be presented for board approval reflecting final legislative actions.
	 
The Tentative Budget is provided as an attachment to this item and also can be accessed on the District's web site.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees approve the Tentative Budget for fiscal year 2014-2015.
items.item_text: FY2014-2015 Tentative Budget
items.item_text_raw: 4. FY2014-2015 Tentative Budget

items.item_details:
On June 26, 2012, the Board of Trustees awarded a contract to CampusWorks for strategic technology infrastructure services for a period of three years, subject to determination of satisfactory performance annually by the Board of Trustees commencing July 1, 2012 and terminating on June 30, 2015 with the intention of transitioning ITSS leadership back to the District in the final year of the contract.
	 
On March 12, 2013, Liz Murphy, CEO of CampusWorks, provided a presentation to the Board of Trustees outlining the work that had been accomplished in the first six months of the contract and identified areas of focus for the following six months.
	 
On June 11, 2013, Ms. Murphy provided a presentation updating the Board of Trustees with an annual report detailing the performance of CampusWorks and compliance with the covenants within the contract.  
	 
Dr. Mike Russell will provide the Board of Trustees with a report detailing the performance of CampusWorks and the transition plan that will transpire in the upcoming fiscal year.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees reafirm the ITSS Leadership Contract with CampusWorks in an amount not to exceed $535,563 for FY2014-2015.
items.item_text: Reaffirmation of CampusWorks ITSS Leadership Contract
items.item_text_raw: 5. Reaffirmation of CampusWorks ITSS Leadership Contract

items.item_details:
The previous Measure G 2004 Bond List Revision was approved by the Board of Trustees on April 8, 2014.  Revisions are presented to the Board on a quarterly basis and as needed. 
                                                                                                                                                                               
This proposed Bond List Revision reflects the efforts to plan and prioritize Measure G-2004 Bond projects at Evergreen Valley College and San Jose City College.  The changes included in this Bond List Revision align project scope and budget with planned implementation efforts to gain efficiency and economy of scale.  There are no revisions to San Jose City College or District projects in this request.  
	 
The Measure G-2004 Bond List Revision dated June 10, 2014 includes the following actions:
	 
Project 223:  Central Green
Budget in the amount of $2,161,991 is being transferred from Project 224 – East Plaza Reconfiguration to Project 223 - Central Green to provide efficiency and to consolidate project scope and scale, project cost and project management. 
Partial budget in the amount of $52,400 is being transferred from Project 223 - Central Green to Project 210- Modernization to Existing Buildings to accommodate project scope and expenses. 
Scope description is being updated to “Projects to improve and develop the campus core consistent with the 2025 Facilities Master Plan.  Projects include those related to safety, site conditions, site reconditioning, hardscape, campus vehicle and pedestrian circulation, walkways and plazas, accessibility, irrigation, way-finding, and lighting.”
Project name is being changed from “Central Green” to “Central Green/Arts Complex”.
	 
Project 224:  East Plaza Reconfiguration
Budget in the amount of $2,161,991 is being transferred from Project 224 – East Plaza Reconfiguration to Project 223 - Central Green to provide efficiency and to consolidate project scope and scale, project cost and project management.  Project 224 is being closed.
	 
Project 210:  Modernization of Existing Buildings
Partial budget in the amount of $52,400 is being transferred from Project 223 - Central Green to Project 210 - Modernization to Existing Buildings to accommodate project scope and expenses.
	 
These Bond List Revisions have been approved by the San Jose City College and Evergreen Valley College Vice Presidents of Administrative Services and the Vice Chancellor of Administrative Services.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees review and approve the revisions to the Measure G - 2004 bond list, as presented.
items.item_text: Measure G-2004 Bond Program: Bond List Revision
items.item_text_raw: 6. Measure G-2004 Bond Program: Bond List Revision

items.item_details:
As part of the accountability measures for the Measure G-2010 Bond Program, the management team for the program has put into place a formal process for managing, tracking and presenting to the Board of Trustees all revisions to the Measure G-2010 individual project names, scopes and budgets.  This process adheres to the accountability standards outlined by Proposition 39 and provides transparency in the evolution of the project list.
	 
These revisions are the result of careful coordination and realignment with the current Facilities Master Plans and the planned implementation of the projects at each campus.
	 
Measure G-2010 Bond List Revision #8 includes the following actions:
	 
Project 31107:  Media Arts Center and Career Technical Education
Project name changed from “Media Arts Center and Career Technical Education” to “Career Technical Education and Media Arts Center” to emphasize career technical education. 
Budget in the amount of $1,135,129 is being transferred from Project 31115- Theater Demo and New Parking Lot to replace additional enhancements to the 100 & 200 Building renovations.
	 
Project 31115:  Theatre Demo and New Parking Lot
Budget in the amount of $1,135,129 is being reallocated to Project 31107- Career Technical Education and Media Arts Center to replace additional enhancements to the 100 & 200 Building renovations. This project is being deferred.
	 
Project 31116:  Campus Site Improvements
Partial scope and budget in the amount of $4,435,618 is to be consolidated into new project, New Gym Sitework & Repurpose Racquetball Building (Project # TBD), for adjacent site work.
	 
Project 31122:  Group II Equipment - $200,000/year for 10 years
A portion of the current budget, in the amount of $400,000 is being reallocated to the new project: New Gym Sitework & Repurpose Racquetball Building (Project # TBD). Budget to be back-filled at a later date with surplus campus contingency.
	 
Project 31321:  Parking Lot & Street Maintenance
Remaining budget in the amount of $1,135,219 being transferred to new project: New Gym Sitework & Repurpose Racquetball Building project (Project # TBD). This project is being deferred.
	 
Project #TBD:  New Gym Sitework & Repurpose Racquetball Building
New project to fund selected components of the New Gym Project due to limited funding resources in the G-2004 Bond Program. 
Budgets transferred from Project 31116- Campus Site Improvements in the amount of $4,435,618, Project 31321- Parking Lot and Street Maintenance in the amount of $1,135,219 and Project C31199- Campus Contingency- San Jose City in the amount of $173,378. 
The scope of this project is to repurpose the existing racquetball building and to complete the site work adjacent to the new gymnasium building.
	 
Project C31199:  Campus Contingency- San Jose City
Budget transfer in the amount of $173,378 to new project, New Gym Sitework & Repurpose Racquetball Building (Project # TBD), to fund selected components of the New Gym Project. 
	 
Project 32113:  Campus Site Improvements
Partial budget in the amount of $300,000 is being transferred from Project 32311 - Campus Water Service Replacement to Project 32113 - Campus Site Improvements for efficiency and consolidation of scope of work within site improvement projects.
 Scope updated to: “Projects to identify and address deficiencies and make improvements throughout the Evergreen Valley campus.  Projects include those related to safety, site conditions, site reconditioning, hardscape, campus vehicle and pedestrian circulation, walkways and plazas, accessibility, irrigation, way-finding, and lighting.” 
	 
Project 32311:  Campus Water Service Replacement
Partial budget in the amount of $300,000 is being transferred from Project 32311 - Campus Water Service Replacement to Project 32113 - Campus Site Improvements for efficiency and consolidation of scope of work within site improvement projects. 
Scope updated to “Projects to address deficiencies and make improvements to the existing campus water system.  These include repair and/or replacement of existing pipe mains and valves, upgrades to and additional water distribution piping systems, and repair/upgrade to system valves, meters and piping throughout campus.”
	 
Project 39301:  New District Office Building
Budget in the amount of $450,188 from Project 39308- Telecommunications Consolidation Antennas is being re-directed to Project 39301 to fund data infrastructure for the new data room at the new district office.
	 
Project 39308:  Telecommunications Consolidation Antennas
In the original Bond List, Campus Police wanted to build out a long-haul wireless infrastructure to relay their radio and data signal throughout the District. This was Project 39308 - Telecommunications Consolidation Antennas.   The new district technology infrastructure will now incorporate this wireless infrastructure requirement, negating the need for a separate project.  It is therefore requested that the budget in the amount of $450,188 from Project 39308- Telecommunications Consolidation Antennas be transferred to Project 39301- New District Office Building, where the district server infrastructure will be located.  As a result, Project 39308 is being cancelled.
	 
Project 39699:  Program Contingency
Fiscal Year 2013-14 Q2 Interest Earnings of $30,007.28 are being allocated to this project. 
	 
These Bond List Revisions have been approved by the San Jose City College and Evergreen Valley College Vice Presidents of Administrative Services and the Vice Chancellor of Administrative Services.
items.item_recommendation: A recommendation that the Board of Trustees review and approve the revisions to the Measure G - 2010 bond list, as presented.
